stream_context.summary: Kaze works on Course 13, an Ice Castle stage for Return to Yoshi’s Island, focusing almost the entire stream on designing and coding a reusable "cracking ice platform" object and its particle/VFX. Minor chat about other planned gimmicks (wind gusts, appearing paths, spinning shards) but not implemented yet.

development_findings.summary: Overall hack is “slightly over 80 % done”; Course 13 is currently in production.
development_findings.quote: The hack is just slightly over 80 percent done I would say.

development_findings.summary: Design goal for Course 13: create several unique ice-themed platform types—cracking ice, spinning ice shards, wind gust windows, and Mario Galaxy–style appearing paths.
development_findings.quote: Ice waves that move forward … an ice platform that cracks on the first jump and breaks on the second … wind gusts … a spinning ice shard … light-bulb style appearing path.

development_findings.summary: Grey-boxing step: Kaze prefers to finish all custom platform objects in Blender first, then build fun layouts from them.
development_findings.quote: I kind of made like the general outline for what I want this level to be like, but I actually haven't programmed the platforming parts yet.

development_findings.summary: Implemented a material/shader system for the cracking ice platform that shows three visual states (solid → cracked → dissolved) using primitive-color alpha tricks and custom texture channels.

Technical hurdle: game crashed because S8 register (display-list head) was mistakenly read instead of the timer; fixing that also accidentally solved a long-standing ROM-pointer mis-alignment bug that broke music/animation in area transitions.
development_findings.quote: I found the issue … it was reading a random memory address instead of the timer … I think I just fixed that whole thing on accident.

development_findings.summary: Particles: re-used the breakable-box triangle emitter but added pale-cyan colour and mist to imply shattering ice; may still tweak spawn pattern to hexagonal burst.
Platform will eventually respawn so players can’t soft-lock; logic still to be added.
Considering removing ‘kicks’ from aerial spin tech to curb sequence breaks; undecided.
development_findings.quote: Put that back in, but remove the kicks … I can definitely see removing kicks being the better option.

development_findings.summary: Controller-pack saves won’t be used because they proved unreliable on real hardware; game continues to rely on cartridge save.
development_findings.quote: I'm not using the controller pack, because when I was a kid, every time I used the controller pack, it didn't work.

development_findings.summary: Release assets: full OST will be uploaded as a playlist after more polishing; no set date.
development_findings.quote: I am planning to upload the full OST at some point.

context_findings.summary: Kaze and Zeina are expecting a baby girl in ~2 months; this affects event attendance (probably skipping F3) and inspires in-chat naming jokes ("Reina/Foe-Zeina").
context_findings.quote: I'm going to have a child … in like two months.

context_findings.summary: Video release philosophy: waiting for Zeina/Eiza to finish a documentary-style concept before releasing the ‘slide’ level video.
context_findings.quote: Eiza wanted it to make like a little bit of a documentary thing almost, so I'm waiting for that to be settled first.

context_findings.summary: Kaze sometimes leaves bug-fixing to the end because “bugs randomly get fixed” while working on new features.
context_findings.quote: Sometimes bugs just randomly get fixed like that … so I don't go bug fixing until the very end.

context_findings.summary: Expressed disdain for ads and products that fund advertising; views himself more as a game developer than a ‘YouTuber’, dislikes the ‘influencer’ label.
context_findings.quote: When I see an ad I actively decide not to buy the product … I've just been a YouTuber, not a game developer.

biobak.summary: Provided ‘appearing path’ concept Kaze wants to integrate and sent multiple Blender files (iceeffect.blend) and texture suggestions for the cracking-ice shader.
biobak.quote: Biobak's appearing path thing, yes. I definitely want that in here.

biobak.summary: Collaborated live on shader math—texture channels, primitive color, dithering—to achieve dissolving effect.

zeina.summary: Planning the game’s next trailer/reveal video with a mini-documentary style.
zeina.quote: Eiza had like a special plan for the video … I'm waiting for that to be settled first.

zeina.summary: Subscribed during stream; involved in baby naming jokes.

key_stories.title: Building the Cracking Ice Platform
key_stories.summary: Kaze spends most of the stream turning a design idea—ice that cracks on first jump and collapses on second—into a functional N64 object with proper textures, alpha blending and particles.
key_stories.challenge: Needed a reusable platform that visually communicates two damage states within strict N64 material limits.
key_stories.process: Iterated in Blender; experimented with primitive-alpha thresholds, dithering, and custom crack textures; debugged crashes caused by wrong pointer; tuned particle emitters for shatter effect.
key_stories.outcome: Working prototype with three-stage visual feedback and pale-cyan triangle shards; still wants better VFX and respawn logic.
key_stories.key_quote: I think this has potential, but it's not good yet.

key_stories.title: Accidental Fix of a Long-Standing Area-Transition Bug
key_stories.summary: While debugging the ice platform, Kaze rewrote a display-list helper and unknowingly eliminated a memory-alignment bug that previously broke music and animations in later areas.
key_stories.challenge: For weeks, entering certain areas misaligned ROM pointers, killing music/animations.
key_stories.process: Re-implemented geo function; realised the code had used the wrong return value; recompiling unexpectedly removed the misalignment.
key_stories.outcome: Bug appears fixed; demonstrates Kaze’s laissez-faire approach to bug hunting.
key_stories.key_quote: No way—that fixed the bug. What the fuck.

key_stories.title: Preparing the Documentary-Style Release Video
key_stories.summary: The planned reveal video for the completed slide level is on hold until Zeina/Eiza finalise a documentary concept, showing the couple’s collaborative dynamic.
key_stories.challenge: Kaze wants a distinctive marketing piece but lacks finished video concept.
key_stories.process: Delegated creative direction to Zeina/Eiza; waiting before recording or publishing footage.
key_stories.outcome: Release timeline delayed; indicates emphasis on quality presentation.
key_stories.key_quote: I'm waiting for that to be settled first, and then I'm making the release video for the slide.
